attributes.action: Prioritise pregnant women for the Covid19 vaccine
attributes.additional_details: Pregnant women are more likely to be admitted to ICU, and their baby is more likely to be born prematurely should they become infected with Covid19. According to a new study, women who have Covid symptoms while carrying a child are over 50pc more likely to experience complications. The Government must step up and protect these vulnerable women from Covid19 as a matter of urgency by prioritising them for the vaccine.
attributes.background: Pregnant women are being vaccinated in-line with their age bracket. This could mean waiting for a further 6 months before they are protected from Covid19. But research has shown that pregnant women and their baby are clinically vulnerable; they must therefore be vaccinated as a priority.
